evidence_collection.quote_text: They specialize in getting us to turn on one another and they get us to turn on one another along lines of left and right, race and gender, creed and culture.
If you are willing to fight for working people regardless of who they are, how they identify, or where they come from, you are welcome here.
evidence_collection.context_type: Implicit support for inclusion, but secondary to class solidarity

evidence_collection.quote_text: And our political system is ill-prepared for this abuse of power.
evidence_collection.context_type: Statement about systemic vulnerability and negative consequences

evidence_collection.quote_text: So I hope that you see this movement is not about partisan labels or purity tests, but about class solidarity.
evidence_collection.context_type: Framing the movement around a unifying principle

evidence_collection.quote_text: And I understand that this kind of disdain that the wealthiest, wealthiest people in this country have for the working class doesn't just come from them not being raised right.
evidence_collection.context_type: Explicitly referencing disdain from the wealthy towards the working class

evidence_collection.quote_text: And the clever thing that these guys sell is making working people like you and me believe that we're just one step outside from that club, that we're just a little bit out from being able to be a billionaire too.
evidence_collection.context_type: Describing a rhetorical strategy to foster envy or aspiration

evidence_collection.quote_text: Donald Trump does see the immense pressure that working people are under. But his answer is an America that operates on the principle of every man for himself, divide and conquer.
evidence_collection.context_type: Characterizing a political figure's strategy as divisive and exploitative

evidence_collection.quote_text: So to all of those who came here today, unsure of whether this is where you belong, I want to tell you that you do.

They want us to think that our lives are suffering because of the LGBT kid down the street or because of the mixed status family or the dreamer down the block who's just trying to make a better life for themselves.
evidence_collection.context_type: Identifying specific groups used to create division and blame

evidence_collection.quote_text: So let's set the record straight.
evidence_collection.context_type: Call for clarity and unity in understanding the issue

evidence_collection.quote_text: However, while we have come a long way from the old injustices that once stained our nation's reputation and denied some Americans the full blessings of American citizenship, the memory of them still had the power to wound.
I have always believed that America offers opportunities to all who have the industry and will to seize it.
This is a dangerous world, and I pledge to him tonight to do all in my power to help him lead us through the many challenges we face.

I urge all Americans - I urge all Americans who supported me to join me in not just congratulating him, but offering our next president our good will and earnest effort to find ways to come together, to find the necessary compromises to bridge our differences and help restore our prosperity, defend our security in a dangerous world, and leave our children and grandchildren a stronger, better country than we inherited.
Whatsoever our differences, we are fellow Americans, and please believe me when I say no association has ever meant more to me than that.
His success alone commands my respect for his ability and perseverance.
I have had and argued our differences, and he has prevailed.
I am so deeply grateful to all of you for the great honor of your support and for all you have done for me.
I don't know what more we could have done to try to win this election.
We must move beyond it and work together to get our country moving again.

The American people are outraged at what's going on, and the American people are saying loud and clear, "We will not accept an oligarchic form of society. We will not accept the richest guy in the world running all over Washington, making cuts to the Social Security Administration, cuts to the Veterans Administration, almost destroying the Department of Education, all so that they could give over a trillion dollars in tax breaks to the wealthiest 1%.
I do not have a PhD in mathematics, but I do know this, that 99% is a hell of a lot larger number than 1%.

In America today, as I think all of you know, sadly and tragically, and we've got to deal with it, we have major epidemics dealing with addiction. I think we lost a hundred thousand Americans last year because of drug overdoses. It's a serious problem in my state. We have people addicted to alcohol, serious problems with alcoholism. We have people who were addicted to tobacco. My father smoked two packs of cigarettes a day and he died before he was 60.

So if we stand together, are strong, are disciplined, are smart, I have every reason to believe deeply in my heart that not only will we defeat Trumpism, but we can create the kind of nation that we deserve.

Now everybody wants to do well in life. Everybody wants to make money. But you would think that if you had a few billion dollars or $10 or $20 billion, you would not feel obliged to step on the backs of poor people to become even richer. But that is exactly what they are doing right now. They are prepared to destroy Social Security, Medicare, Medicares, the Veterans Administration in order to make themselves even richer.

They own mansions all over the world. They go on vacations to their own private islands. When they want to go someplace, they don't go into their car. They go into the planes or the helicopters that they own.

But to tell you one of the more bizarre experiences of my life was I was kind of pushed into the front row of that. And there I am, there's Trump, and right behind him, you got Musk, Bezos, and Zuckerberg, three wealthiest guys in the country. And then behind them, you got 13 other billionaires who Trump nominated to head up various government agencies.

I don't care if you are a Republican, Democrat, or independent, I don't think there's anybody who thinks it vaguely makes sense that the richest guy in the world could spend $270 million to get Trump elected and then become the most powerful person in the government.
They are busy doing right now is going after Medicare, going after Social Security, going after nutrition. The rich want to get richer and they don't care who they step on.

So if we stand together, are strong, are disciplined, are smart, I have every reason to believe deeply in my heart that not only will we defeat Trumpism, but we can create the kind of nation that we deserve.

We have a constitution that's got to be restored. And so our obligation then is to say, "Mr. President, you're lame duck. Let's stick with the tradition. Let's stick with the practice. Let's stick with the statements that have been made by a number of Democrats in the past when the shoe was on the other foot.

And so therefore, if we're going to support and defend the Constitution, encourage the, the nomination and the advice and the consent, the confirmation of the Senate and encourage them, then a presidental appointment to the Supreme Court of someone whom the president is incapable of nominating anyone to the Supreme Court that what the Constitution says and what was understood to mean at the time of its ratification.

And that was June 24th on Thursday, and it would kick the breath out of your gut to hear that if you're a constitutionalist. And it brings you to a sad state of mourn. And you'd lay your head down on the pillow at night having trouble to sleep, thinking, "What am I going to do tomorrow? I couldn't react today. What am I going to do tomorrow? Lord, wake me up with an idea on how to, how to preserve our Constitution."
And I'd ask Mr. Speaker that this country keep the families of these victims in their prayers every day until such time as we restore.

Federal law requires that when immigration law enforcement officers encounter an individual is unlawful present in the United States, quote, he shall be placed in removable proceedings, close quote. That's the law. And our Border Patrol officers are told, quote, If you're here to enforce the law and you're determined to do so, you're better get yourself another job. They've become the Welcome Wagon on the southern border.
The Supreme Court ruled with the majority opinion written by the Chief Justice of the Supreme Court, but they could add words into the Obama care where it says, the states may establish exchanges.

Mr. President, you're lame duck. Let's stick with the tradition. Let's stick with the practice. Let's stick with the statements that have been made by a number of Democrats in the past when the shoe was on the other foot.
Thank you, Mr. Speaker. It's my privilege to have the opportunity to address you here on the floor of the United States House of Representatives.

And that's what that means to me. Um, but, but the, um, parents, the parents of Americans is what the President would like to call it. Defered action for parents of Americans, DAP. Well, here's. I watched one of those parents of Americans, parent now comes across the border in an, in an inflatble raft with two coyotes.

And so our obligation then is to say, "Mr. President, you're lame duck. Let's stick with the tradition. Let's stick with the practice. Let's stick with the statements that have been made by a number of Democrats in the past when the shoe was on the other foot."
